info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, northern Nottoway and southwestern Amelia Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burkeville, or 7 miles west of Crewe, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burkeville around 1115 PM EDT. Crewe around 1120 PM EDT. Jetersville around 1130 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse around 1145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Prince Edward Station, Twin Lakes State Park, Burkes Tavern, Moran, Maplewood, Fergusonville, Jennings Ordinary, Prince Edward Lake, Deatonville and Oliveville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
